turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Letter (Judy Garland album).
turn.2: The Letter (Judy Garland album) The Letter is a 1959 concept album by American vocalist Judy Garland arranged by Gordon Jenkins.
turn.4: Chronicling a relationship, the album features John Ireland.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The Allmusic review by John Bush awarded the album three stars and said "Jenkins' ambitious concept was written well and executed perfectly, and no one was better than Garland for a dramatic romantic role encompassing hope and humor... "The Letter" suffers, as all but the best concept albums do.
turn.8: Ireland is no match for Garland...and the few audio concepts on display tend toward gimmicks.
turn.9: What audio concepts are on display?
turn.10: In all, "The Letter" is a fair concept album, its interruptions annoying but its overall power raised by the twin talents of Garland and Jenkins...
turn.12: The original three-track stereo recording is exquisite, and upon its initial release, special copies of "the letter" were placed in envelopes and taped to the front of each record jacket".
